plan: Arrive Milan, visit Duomo, Duomo Museum and rooftop, Galleria Vittorio Emanuele II and Rinascente; explore nearby streets and Christmas market.
transportTip: Use ATM metro (Duomo / Cordusio). A 24h ticket is convenient if you ride more than twice.
foodTip: Look for risotto alla milanese, ossobuco and aperitivo near Duomo or Brera.
mustDo: Go onto the Duomo rooftop for sunset, walk through the Galleria and see the Christmas tree.
mustBuy: Panettone, truffle chocolates, Italian fashion or leather accessories.
weather: Typical mid-December Milan: around 0–8°C, often cloudy or foggy, cold at night.

plan: San Siro stadium match or tour; visit Santa Maria delle Grazie to see The Last Supper (pre-booked slot).
transportTip: Take metro M5 to San Siro; book Last Supper entry well in advance and arrive 15–20 mins early.
foodTip: Try cotoletta alla milanese and a local trattoria dinner near Cadorna or Brera.
mustDo: Photo at San Siro, quiet walk around the church after seeing The Last Supper.
mustBuy: Club merchandise (AC Milan / Inter), small religious souvenirs near the church.
weather: Similar to Day 1: cold, 0–8°C, bring warm coat, scarf and gloves.

plan: Train from Milano Centrale to Varenna-Esino, ferry to Bellagio and Varenna old town; stroll lakeside and return by evening.
transportTip: Take Trenord train to Varenna-Esino (sit on the left leaving Milan for best lake views) and use ferries between Varenna, Bellagio and Menaggio.
foodTip: Taste lake fish dishes and gelato in Bellagio; choose a café with lake view.
mustDo: Sunset or blue-hour photos over the lake, short walk up in Varenna for panoramic views.
mustBuy: Como silk products, local olive oil or wine in small shops.
weather: Lake Como: about 2–7°C, damp and colder by the water, can be foggy.

plan: High-speed train from Milan to Venezia S. Lucia, check-in, explore Cannaregio and central Venice; evening dinner at Impronta.
transportTip: Use ACTV vaporetto (water bus); consider 24h pass if you will ride several times.
foodTip: Enjoy cicchetti (Venetian tapas) with spritz in bacari; dinner at Impronta if reserved.
mustDo: Sunset walk from Rialto Bridge towards St Mark’s Square and back at night when crowds are lower.
mustBuy: Small Murano glass items or handmade mask; avoid very cheap tourist stalls.
weather: Venice in mid-December is often 2–8°C, humid, with mist or light rain possible.

plan: Morning train from Venice to Florence; visit Mercato Centrale for food, Santa Maria Novella surroundings, Florence Cathedral area and Accademia or other museums.
transportTip: Florence is very walkable from S.M.Novella station; no need for public transport for central sights.
foodTip: Try bistecca alla fiorentina at a reputable trattoria (e.g. Dall’Oste or similar) and panini like All’antico Vinaio.
mustDo: Evening view of the Duomo and Piazza della Signoria; stroll across Ponte Vecchio if time.
mustBuy: Leather goods, handmade stationery, products from Officina Profumo-Farmaceutica di Santa Maria Novella.
weather: Florence: about 3–10°C; cool but often sunnier than northern Italy.

plan: Train to Pisa S. Rossore, walk to Piazza dei Miracoli to see Leaning Tower and cathedral, then back to Florence for afternoon/evening.
transportTip: Use regional train Florence–Pisa; from Pisa S. Rossore it is a short walk to the Leaning Tower complex.
foodTip: Enjoy casual lunch near Piazza dei Miracoli, then back in Florence have gelato and a simple trattoria dinner.
mustDo: Classic Leaning Tower photos and relaxed walk around Piazza dei Miracoli.
mustBuy: Small Pisa souvenirs or magnets; in Florence, more leather or local wine.
weather: Pisa/Florence: around 4–11°C, may be breezy near open spaces.

plan: Train to Rome; visit Colosseum, Roman Forum and Palatine Hill, then Piazza Venezia and nearby streets.
transportTip: Use metro B (Colosseo) and walk between ancient sites; buy a day pass if using metro/bus several times.
foodTip: Try carbonara or cacio e pepe at a good trattoria; avoid aggressive tourist menus right next to main sights.
mustDo: Golden-hour view of the Forum from above; night lights around the Vittoriano (Altare della Patria).
mustBuy: Postcards, history-themed books, or small replicas of ancient statues.
weather: Rome: typically 5–12°C, milder than northern Italy, occasional showers.

plan: Morning Vatican Museums, Sistine Chapel, St Peter’s Basilica and dome if desired; afternoon and evening in Trastevere and Tiber Island.
transportTip: Use metro A (Ottaviano) or bus to Vatican; then walk across the river towards Trastevere.
foodTip: Eat near Vatican for lunch; in the evening, enjoy trattoria dinner in Trastevere with Roman specialties.
mustDo: Climb St Peter’s dome if weather is clear; night walk in Trastevere’s lanes and main square.
mustBuy: Rosary, Vatican stamps or religious souvenirs around the Basilica area.
weather: Similar to Day 7: 5–12°C, bring a light down jacket and umbrella.

plan: Navona Square Christmas market, Pantheon exterior/interior, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and shopping streets.
transportTip: Mostly walking; you can use metro A (Spagna) for Spanish Steps and then walk back.
foodTip: Try maritozzo with cream from a good pasticceria and gelato near Pantheon.
mustDo: Throw a coin in Trevi Fountain, sunset at Spanish Steps if weather allows.
mustBuy: Italian fashion on Via del Corso or Via dei Condotti, plus sweets like biscotti.
weather: Cool but pleasant if sunny, around 6–12°C.

plan: Flight Rome to Paris Orly, transfer to Montparnasse; light exploration nearby (Montparnasse streets, café, evening stroll).
transportTip: Use OrlyBus or OrlyVal + RER/metro to reach Montparnasse; then rely on metro and walking.
foodTip: Start with a simple brasserie dinner: onion soup, steak-frites or confit de canard.
mustDo: Short evening walk around Montparnasse and first view of Paris Christmas lights.
mustBuy: French pastries or a baguette sandwich from a nearby bakery.
weather: Paris mid-December: around 2–8°C, often cloudy with chance of light rain.

plan: Sainte-Chapelle, Conciergerie, Louvre visit, Musée de l’Armée / Invalides and Seine stroll.
transportTip: Use metro lines 4/1 for Cité and Louvre; line 8 for Invalides; walking between river sights is pleasant.
foodTip: Lunch near Île de la Cité or Louvre (croque-monsieur, quiche), dinner near Invalides or Saint-Germain.
mustDo: See stained glass in Sainte-Chapelle and evening view of the Seine near Pont Alexandre III.
mustBuy: Small art prints or Louvre-themed souvenirs; chocolate from a Parisian chocolatier.
weather: Cool and damp, similar 2–8°C; gets dark around 17:00, perfect for lights on the bridges.

plan: Morning Louvre deep visit, afternoon trip to Château de Versailles and Grand Trianon; evening Seine stroll.
transportTip: Metro line 1 to Louvre; then RER C from central Paris (e.g. Invalides) to Versailles-Château-Rive Gauche.
foodTip: Have lunch around Tuileries; at Versailles try a simple brasserie or grab-and-go in the town.
mustDo: Hall of Mirrors in Versailles and Louvre’s Denon wing highlights.
mustBuy: Versailles-themed souvenirs or books, plus French skincare from Paris pharmacies.
weather: 2–7°C, colder in Versailles gardens with wind; dress warmly and wear good shoes.

plan: Invalides/Napoleon’s tomb, walk along the Seine to Champ de Mars and Eiffel Tower, dinner near Champs-Élysées and Christmas lights plus Arc de Triomphe.
transportTip: Use metro lines 8 and 6, and walk between Invalides, Pont Alexandre III, and Eiffel Tower.
foodTip: Christmas dinner at a brasserie or restaurant near Champs-Élysées; book ahead as it is busy.
mustDo: Watch Eiffel Tower lights at dusk, then see Champs-Élysées Christmas decorations.
mustBuy: Macarons, Eiffel Tower souvenirs, or small luxury items from the avenue.
weather: Often cold and crisp: about 2–6°C; may feel extra chilly at night.

plan: Last Paris activities or shopping in the morning, then Eurostar from Gare du Nord to London St Pancras in the afternoon.
transportTip: Use metro to Gare du Nord; in London start using Underground or bus with contactless card.
foodTip: Final Paris pastries in the morning; in London, try a pub dinner near your hotel or around the South Bank.
mustDo: Quick final walk in Paris (maybe Tuileries or along the Seine) before the train.
mustBuy: Last-minute French souvenirs (chocolate, wine, macarons) before entering UK customs rules.
weather: Paris morning: similar to previous days. London evening: about 3–9°C, often cloudy or drizzly.

plan: Explore Southbank Centre Winter Market, London Bridge area, and Covent Garden; evening by the Thames if time before departure next day.
transportTip: Use Tube and buses with contactless payment; central London is walkable between some key areas.
foodTip: Have fish & chips, a Sunday-style roast if available, or market street food by the river.
mustDo: Night view of the Thames and London Eye lit up, plus Covent Garden Christmas decorations.
mustBuy: English tea, biscuits, or souvenirs like football items or Harry Potter gifts.
weather: London mid-December: around 3–9°C, frequent clouds, light rain possible; feels colder in the wind.
